tweets.text:
After walking from #Freckenham down gorgeous Kennett-Lee Brook, a perfect-looking #chalkstream, as I slipped into #RiverLark at West Row on a perfect Saturday a.m., was buzzing with anticipation for a swim up Lee Brook. But, horrors! For almost a mile a DEAD ZONE! 
#MySwim 
1/7 https://t.co/R6psn3QXA6

After walking from #Freckenham down gorgeous Kennett-Lee Brook, a perfect-looking #chalkstream, as I slipped into #RiverLark at West Row on a perfect Saturday a.m., was buzzing with anticipation for a swim up Lee Brook. But, horrors! For almost a mile a DEAD ZONE! 
#MySwim 
1/7 https://t.co/7d17b2iijn

@m_h_shelton @HeritageFundUK @WessexRivers @EnvAgency I used to get mine from Filcris https://t.co/QtEM6UDxxi - they now only sell rafts where the polystyrene floats are encased with recycled plastic edging if it helps! I know @EssexWT_Darren was investigating alternatives to polystyrene use in rafts ages ago, any thoughts Darren?

Something to get passionate about @WaterUK @DefraWater @OfwatChiefExec @EnvAgency have made it this way and can stop it right now - no new law required, just stop bending it. @RachSalv @AnglingTrust @WildlifeTrusts https://t.co/GXWd0xbOKc

@EnvAgency’s No1 environmental issue in the UK. WHO limits of human health and nuisance levels broken. 5 breaches of permit causing significant harm to human health. Hundreds of complaints to @PHE_WestMids. GP consultations on the rise.WHY IS THIS NOT NATIONAL NEWS? #stopthestink https://t.co/f2G6fFOtRI

Risk to health - many parents are frightened what this may mean for the long term health of their children @MattHancock Can you & @PHE_EoEngland address the town as a matter of urgency please? @BBCPanorama #stopthestink @StinkStopthe https://t.co/8PWAahQD08
